newsitem.title: RUSSIA: New Russian budget draft retains old tax proposals.
newsitem.headline: New Russian budget draft retains old tax proposals.

text.p: The Russian government has retained several old tax proposals in its new 1997 budget draft, a State Duma lower house deputy said on Friday.
Budget committee member Oksana Dmitriyeva told Reuters the new draft preserved a 15-percent tax on government securities operations and an income tax on operations with banking deposits.

She said the taxes had already been rejected by the Duma and could be removed by a conciliation commission set up after parliament sent the original 1997 draft back to the government, criticising unrealistically high revenues plans.
"It is symptomatic that the government does not offer any other alternatives," Dmitriyeva said. "Borrowing on the domestic market has also increased a bit."

The government on Thursday agreed on a new draft budget, cutting planned revenues to 432.8 trillion roubles from 433.64 trillion in the first draft and trimming expenditures to 523.5 trillion roubles from 524.34 trillion.
The budget deficit remains unchanged at 3.3 percent of gross domestic product, or 90.70 trillion roubles.
The government will send the new draft to the Duma at the weekend. The conciliation commission has 10 days to put it into shape.
